description: Interstellar is a 2014 science fiction film about a team of astronauts who travel through a cosmic wormhole in search of a habitable planet as the Earth is ravaged by worldwide crop blights, dust storms, and the atmosphere loses oxygen.
excerpts: Interstellar is a 2014 science fiction film about a team of astronauts who travel through a cosmic wormhole in search of a habitable planet as the Earth is ravaged by worldwide crop blights, dust storms, and the atmosphere loses oxygen.

description: Cooper is a widowed astronaut and one of the main characters in the film.
excerpts: Cooper: 'We've always defined ourselves by the ability to overcome the impossible.'
Cooper: 'Once you're a parent, you're the ghost of your children's future.'
Cooper: 'We used to look up at the sky and wonder at our place in the stars, now we just look down and worry about our place in the dirt.'
Cooper: 'Mankind was born on Earth, it was never meant to die here.'

description: Professor Brand is a character in the film who plays a key role in the mission to find a habitable planet.
excerpts: Professor Brand: 'Do not go gentle into that good night.'
Professor Brand: 'We're not meant to save the world, we're meant to leave it.'
Professor Brand: 'We must reach far beyond our own lifespans, we must think not as individuals but as a species.'
Professor Brand: 'We must confront the reality of interstellar travel.'

description: Murphy Cooper is Cooper's daughter and plays a significant role in the film.
excerpts: Murphy Cooper: 'Today is my birthday and it's a special one because you once told me that when you came back, we might be the same age.'
Murphy Cooper: 'Love is the one thing that transcends time and space.'
Murphy Cooper: 'Maybe we've spent too long trying to figure all this out with theory.'
Murphy Cooper: 'You were thinking about getting home, I was trying to do the right thing.'

description: Amelia Brand is a character in the film and a member of the team searching for a habitable planet.
excerpts: Amelia Brand: 'Love is the one thing that transcends time and space.'
Amelia Brand: 'Maybe we've spent too long trying to figure all this out with theory.'
Amelia Brand: 'You might have to decide between seeing your children again and the future of the human race.'

description: TARS is a robot character in the film that provides assistance to the astronauts.
excerpts: TARS: 'Everybody good? Plenty of slaves for my robot colony.'
TARS: 'I have a cue light I can use to show you when I'm joking, if you like.'
TARS: 'Lower than yours apparently.'
TARS: 'Confirmed self-destruct sequence in T minus 10, 9...'

description: Key dialogue exchanges from the film.
excerpts: Cooper: 'You don't believe we went to the moon.'
Professor Brand: 'We must confront the reality that nothing in our solar system can help us.'
Cooper: 'What happened to Miller?' Brand: 'Judging by the wreckage, she was broken up by a wave shortly after impact.'
Cooper: 'Time is relative. It can stretch and squeeze, but it can't run backwards.'
Cooper: 'The beings that led us here, they communicate through gravity. Could they be talking to us from the future?'
Cooper: 'I screwed up, but you know about relativity.'
TARS: 'This is not possible.' Cooper: 'No, it's necessary.'
Cooper: 'What are you doing, TARS?' TARS: 'Docking.'
Cooper: 'There's no point in using our fuel to chase.'
Cooper: 'We want to get down fast, don't we?' Brand: 'Actually, we want to get there in one piece.'
TARS: 'Confirmed self-destruct sequence in T minus 10, 9...'
Cooper: 'We've always defined ourselves by the ability to overcome the impossible.'
Cooper: 'Once you're a parent, you're the ghost of your children's future.'
Cooper: 'We used to look up at the sky and wonder at our place in the stars, now we just look down and worry about our place in the dirt.'
Cooper: 'Mankind was born on Earth, it was never meant to die here.'
